{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2977169,"name":"","username":"KGB","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/74df32/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-11-16T21:20:51.855Z","cooked":"

Is there any example Python (robotpy) code for using Talon controllers with encoders? Ideally with mecanum drive.

We have basic mecanum drive working via robotpy using ctre.WPI_TalonSRX, but are trying to understand how to make use of encoders connected to our Talons. Noob

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2021-11-16T21:20:51.855Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":75,"reads":78,"readers_count":77,"score":405.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":397382,"topic_slug":"python-examples-using-talons-with-encoders","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49837,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/python-examples-using-talons-with-encoders/397382/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":2977174,"name":"Ben Bistline","username":"benjiboy2539","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/benjiboy2539/{size}/127059_2.png","created_at":"2021-11-16T21:35:03.814Z","cooked":"

We used Talon SRXs with the encoders in a mecanum drive in 2019! Also in Python!

Find our code here!

Majority of the code you will want to see will be in subsystems/basedrive.py. If you want to learn more about how we did mecanum-specific tasks, look at subsystems/mecanumdrive.py. Note that MecanumDrive inherits from and overrides parts of BaseDrive!

benjiboy2539:

here

Awesome, thank you! As newbies, are there any good introductions to the concepts of using encoders and the associated wpilib/ctre library support?

RobotPy has examples in each of the repos for the various vendor libraries.
So, for CTRE, you can find a few examples here

github.com

robotpy-ctre/examples at main · robotpy/robotpy-ctre

main/examples

RobotPy wrappers for CTRE third party extensions for WPILib

For Rev, you can find them here

github.com

robotpy-rev/examples at main · robotpy/robotpy-rev

main/examples

RobotPy bindings for the REV Robotics SPARK MAX. Contribute to robotpy/robotpy-rev development by creating an account on GitHub.

and for the Rev color sensor, you can find one here.

github.com

robotpy-rev-color/examples/read_rgb_values at main · robotpy/robotpy-rev-color

main/examples/read_rgb_values

Python wrappers for REV Robotics Color Sensor V3. Contribute to robotpy/robotpy-rev-color development by creating an account on GitHub.

The RobotPY examples do have some resources; however, the CTRE examples are heavily limited.

Like I said above, feel free to look at my team’s code. The robotpy documentation also provides great explanations as to what the methods do.

And of course CTRE has some general examples (although they aren’t directly shown in Python they’re not necessarily difficult). I definitely recommend looking here.

Lastly, CD is a great place to ask for advice and ask questions. All this knowledge comes with experience!
